partial_factors.missing_components: US Fed gold certificate reserves only; no global central bank gold holdings or official sector accumulation. FRED does not provide World Gold Council–type central bank buying data.

missing_factors.reason: No total gold ETF holdings series (e.g. GLD, IAU) found in dataset. FRED may host limited ETF data; commodities/precious-metals categories may be outside fetch scope.

No gold spot price series (e.g. GOLDAMGBD228NLBM, GOLDPMGBD228) found in all_series_merged.json. FRED hosts LBMA Gold Price series; commodities/precious-metals category may not be included in the fetch scope.
No US gold production or global mining proxy series found. If available in FRED, the relevant category was not included in the merged dataset.
Not covered by FRED. World Gold Council and similar sources required; structurally unavailable.

data_quality_issues.description: Gold spot price is mandatory for gold analysis. Its absence prevents computing gold returns and limits dependent analysis.
CPIAUCSL (headline CPI All Items, monthly SA) referenced in notes of other series but not present as a direct series in the merged file. PCEPI and CPILFESL provide alternative inflation measures.
Real GDP (GDPC1) and real GDP growth (A191RL1) not found. GDP-related series present are deflators and sum-of-pieces; CGDPESUSA666NRUG provides Penn World Table real GDP (annual).
Some series appear in multiple category files (e.g. exchange rates in both by_country and trade_weighted_indexes). Merge may contain duplicates; deduplication by id recommended.

conclusion: The dataset covers most macroeconomic and risk-sentiment proxies required for gold driver analysis: real yields (DGS10, DFII10, T10YIE), monetary policy (FEDFUNDS, WALCL), USD (DTWEXBGS), inflation (PCEPI, CPILFESL), employment (PAYEMS, UNRATE), VIX, S&P 500, and economic policy uncertainty. Critical gaps: (1) Gold spot price is absent—mandatory for gold analysis and disqualifies a High score. (2) GDPC1/A191RL1 not present. (3) Central bank gold and ETF holdings are partial or unavailable. (4) Mining and jewelry demand are outside FRED’s scope. To reach High suitability: add GOLDAMGBD228NLBM (or equivalent), GDPC1, and A191RL1. Score: Medium (≈62% factors covered fully or partially; 8 full, 1 partial, 4 missing).
